issues.title: Does not work for LuxRender
issues.body:
Hello!
I build project from branch 0.3 but it does not work for [LuxRender](http://www.luxrender.net/en_GB/download), I checked with [LuxMark](http://www.luxrender.net/wiki/LuxMark#Binaries), some actions are happening, it can be seen from what the server writes in the log and on loading video cards, but it like it's in some kind of the moment it freeze. 
I tried to use: 1. the server on Linux (Ubuntu), and the client on Windows 10; 2. server and client on Windows 10.
Help me please solve the problem.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #5 from ArsenShnurkov/patch-1

fix of markup

issue_comments.body:
Hi Jose!
Sorry for not answering for some days, I am new to github and this is my first pull request so I've missed the notification.
I really need OpenCL over netvork implementation, it would be great if you grant acces for me. What I need for my customer now is reliable and fast platfom working from both linux and windows. I am working on clEnqueueReadBufferRect now, planning to make some tests and start windows port after it. I am not a fan of windows but cross-platform ocland will cover more usecases of OpenCL-enabled software.
The idea of separate data streams is reasonable, I would be glad to participate in futher ocland development.

Hi Alex!
I have tried running LuxMark on ocland last year and it had hung too. I was not able to fix these hangs. Do you have a specific interest on ocland+LuxMark? Patches for fixing ocland freeze on LuxMark are very welcome. Notifying @sanguinariojoe the world needs this project is also a good help.

Hi Timur! And thanks!

I already merged your branch. Do you want to get access on the project? (I really need help with it)

As you can appreciate the version 0.1 was just a proof of concept, but In branch 0.2 I'm trying to get a reliable and fast platform.

First I'm triying to develop as best as possible "initialization stage", i.e. all the stuff but the queues.

The point on the queues is that we need a completely different paradigm, with at least 4 additional data streams:

Upload queue
Download queue
Upload buffer/image stream
Download buffer/image stream

Otherwise when you enque a command, and in the case you want to retrieve an event to track, you must wait for the server answer, delaying all the execution.

I granted you access as collaborator (if you may commit one change to check would be fine)

Welcome to ocland!!!

Hey Alex and Timur!

I'm afraid ocland is dead... Very sad... However, there are some other alternatives you may consider (see below). It would be really nice if you give back some feedback about them here!

VOCL:
Pretty similar to ocland... Theoretically you can just simply run your OpenCL program without modifying even a single line of code. Seems too old, probably is not working
https://trac.mcs.anl.gov/projects/vocl/changeset/380/trunk?old_path=%2F&format=zip):

dOpenCL:
Similar to ocland as well. You should give a try!
http://www.uni-muenster.de/imperia/md/content/pvs/forschung/dopencl/dopencl-0.4.0_r1731.tar.gz

CLara:
The website is dead... I would say it is similar to ocland... Who knows...
https://sourceforge.net/projects/clara/

SnuCL:
Seems very professional. However, I guess it is requiring changes on the source code, or at least in the compilation and execution process.
http://snucl.snu.ac.kr/snucl.html

VCL:
It's cost-free, but not libre/open-source
http://www.mosix.org/txt_vcl.html/

rCUDA:
For CUDA language... I can't even see the license, but seems they don't allows software redistribution. Probably you can just ignore that
http://www.rcuda.net/index.php/software-request-form.html
